thread.title: Jake Arrieta's son Cooper may be the best part of the Cubs Wild Card win
thread.title_full: Jake Arrieta's son Cooper may be the best part of the Cubs Wild Card win | Chicago Sun-Times

title: Jake Arrieta's son Cooper may be the best part of the Cubs Wild Card win
text:
Kids, for the most part, are adorable. Even the most hard core sports fan can’t help buy smile a little when they see a player’s son or daughter get all giggly during postgame comments.
This was never more obvious than during NBA playoffs when the world was introduced to Riley Curry. However, Chicago may have a child star of their own as Jake Arrieta’s son stole the postgame show.
A picture of three-year-old Cooper Arrieta pouring champagne into his dad’s mouth swept the internet Thursday. But this is far from the first time Cooper has mad Cubs fans say “aww!”
Start Slideshow » Sure, the moment between the married couple is great, but Cooper steals the show staring straight through the camera
Don't worry Dad, Cooper's got this under control. The little guy pours champagne in (and around) Jake's mouth
Sure Jake may have just pitched, but how could he say no to a bike ride to a face like that? Check out those sunglasses!
Oh, that wasn’t enough to convince everyone that Cooper is the cutest little Cub in the world? Then check out his postgame celebrations.
https://twitter.com/MrsArrieta49/media
Go Cubs Go #LetsGo #wearegood @JArrieta34 our kid has some sick moves pic.twitter.com/Egm2m0TZNr
— Brittany Arrieta (@MrsArrieta49) April 26, 2015
@JArrieta34 @DexterFowler @Cubs Cubs W made this lil man very happy, now we wait for Daddy to get home… #LetsGo pic.twitter.com/7bP7wwY4Xw
— Brittany Arrieta (@MrsArrieta49) April 12, 2015
Photos courtesy of: @JArrieta34 @MrsArrieta49 and SBNation
